pages.title: Teas
pages.text: Throughout all my struggles, nothing has made me feel more at ease. I found my tea bush in a swamp, but it seems like they can grow even if you relocate them. I sometimes like to let it grow past its green stage, shearing it only after it yellows or blackens. The color of the leaves really change the taste and feel of $(l:cooking/kettle)the brews I make$(/l) with them.

pages.title: Coffee
pages.text: In burning hellscapes—planted on basalt—coffee bushes seem to do fine on their own with a bit of time. In the grasses of my yard, it finally grew when I planted it in the center of a 5x5 field of other crops, but only because it paracitically leeched off of them, withering them to dust. Luckily the $(l:cooking/kettle)caffeine these berries give me$(/l) is well worth the trouble.

pages.title: Pollinating Fruits
pages.text: I've realised that simply planting some fruits is not enough. Without bee pollination, they produce nothing at all. This has been the case for limes which I found in the flower forest, and pomegranates which my friend gathered from warped forests.

pages.title: Bananas
pages.text: For the longest time, I didn't understand why my banana stalks weren't growing. I stacked my banana fronds on a block of gravel like I was supposed to! Turns out that rain is vital for this growth process. I should see if I can't make a sprinkler...

pages.title: White Strawberries
pages.text: I love strawberries, but I was really shocked to find white ones! I was climbing a mountain when I came upon them. I think they only grow above the clouds where the air is less dense.

pages.title: Allergic Reaction?
pages.text: Something I've been growing has really thrown me off, but I'm not sure what. I'm coughing all the time and I can't sleep. My friends are inching farther away each night. I think they're scared of catching whatever I've got.
